paper.title: Ex Ante Predictability of Rapid Growth: A Design Science Approach
paper.abstract: We examine how machine learning (ML) predictions of high-growth enterprises (HGEs) help a budget-constrained venture capitalist source investments for a fixed size portfolio. Applying a design science approach, we predict HGEs 3 years ahead and focus on decision (not statistical) errors, using an accuracy measure relevant to the decision-making context. We find that when the ML procedure adheres to the budget constraint and maximizes the accuracy measure, nearly 40% of the HGE predictions are correct. Moreover, ML performs particularly well where it matters in practice-in the upper tail of the distribution of the predicted HGE probabilities. JEL Classification: C53, D22, L25

domain_result.justification: 该论文研究了机器学习如何帮助风险投资家在预算约束下选择高增长企业进行投资组合构建，这直接涉及投资组合管理的核心问题。
